The quality of food you remember from 3A's (former restaurant in this location), with the class this part of Hoboken needed. The atmosphere is gorgeous and plays into the the vintner theme without crossing into kitsch. Think trellises, romantic lighting, rich wooden accents. Their wine selection is robust and--in Hoboken--only paralleled by Bin 14. This place is much larger, but certainly swanky and intimate enough for a date. The food menu is highly focused on some exceptional, elevated Italian favorites. You won't leave hungry, but try to save room for dessert. Also, even in their opening week, the service was extremely warm and attentive, so I can only expect there to be even more finesse and polish as time goes on.

We dined with a group of 6 last evening. We are all very experienced diners. The overall service was fair at best and very loud. The food was very good and we sampled a solid variety of starters of artichokes and calamari. The entrees were short ribs/strip steak/sea bass/cappelini and chicken and everyone enjoyed.  The issues and reason for 3 stars along with reasons that will preclude an imminent return are:  It was wine down wends. The only offerings were 2 white wines. What restaurant would not have a red wine choice is puzzling especially since several of us only drink red wine. We ordered truffle fries and we were asked would you like before or with entrée and we indicated with entrée. To our surprise they arrived 15 minutes prior by the runner. It was hard to find waitress but she was difficult to corral. Finally after enjoying the meals we  were excited to enjoy the  chipwich and flourless chocolate cake for desert only to be told they were sold out. We were disappointed especially since 90% of dining room was in midst of dinner and we were early ones to sit. It just seems like these were never available. I don't recall menu stating 20% gratuity for 6 people but will inquire because honestly overall experience did not warrant. There are many restaurants in and around Hoboken that offer the complete package .Overall Fair experience

The food and service was amazing! We had a party of 17 people that they accommodated wonderfully. Those who arrived early were able to enjoy the bar and the impressive beer, wine, and cocktail menu available. The service was on point even with the large group we had, and everyone left satisfied. The entire dinner from start to finish was a fantastic experience and I will be sure to come back here and recommend it to my friends and family.

I'm with Jessica W. on this one. Super confused on the hype. Went after exceptional ratings from more than one person only to be met with major disappointment. The vibe here is way snooty and we had bartender Rich who played favorites with his clientele all night. Don't recommend if you're looking for an enjoyable atmosphere and a place you'll get the service you'd expect at a basic human level.

This place is just what Hoboken needed! I was so impressed with the decor, the food and especially the wine.The inside looks like a beautiful backyard garden, perfect for a date night or girls night photo ops. They even took their time decorating the bathroom walls with wine crates which is definitely a nice touch (and an idea I want to steal for own home!)The food was really delicious and memorable. My date and I split the tuna tartar (special), veal meatballs, and baked eggplant for appetizers, then we split the NY strip and Hoboken Shrimp for entrees. All were fantastic! The steak was honestly cooked perfectly (medium rare), and the shrimp were so flavorful I am already planning my next trip back for more. The wine list is really impressive with different types of wine and prices, so it feels like there is something for everyone. They have wine on tap which I wanted to try, but will save for next time. They also have a great cocktail list and beer selection if wine isn't your thing. We split a great bottle of Montepulciano. I highly recommend this spot to anyone! Even though I want to keep it to myself...

The place is beautiful and very well decor, staff were nice and food was delicious.  Everything from the wine , the pasta and the dessert was tasty and really good. The only thing that we didn't like was that the tables were very close to each other and you could literally hear others conversations. (Which became a problem were the ladies sitting next to us were basically screaming and we could barely hear each other...) The ambiance overall was really nice. Perfect for a date. Would definitely come back.

Finally!  Great food and a great vibe in one place, in the Ho!  My GF and I went to this place on a Friday night at about 8:30 for a 9:00 reservation. The place was packed but we were seated immediately, so that was nice.  We looked over the menu and picked some drinks and appetizers, and waited for the server, who essentially didn't show up the entire night (the only reason I give this place four instead of five stars---maybe updated next time we go).  Fortunately, the manager seems to be aware of how bad at least this waitress is, so he spent the evening watching over us to make sure that we were able to order, etc.  Anyway....for appetizers, we ordered the steamed artichoke from the menu and a tuna tartare special.  The artichoke, in particular, was fantastic.  The tartare was good but fairly standard as tartare go.  For our mains, my GF (who is vegan) ordered the salad and a side of broccoli rabe.  I ordered a fra diavolo pasta special.  We both loved our dishes -- the fra diavolo may be the best one I have ever had, anywhere.  One thing that interested me is the bwines they have on their drink menu.  We did not try one, but I do intend to go back and try them.  They are supposedly beers that drink like wine.  They have a great wine list, too, including a couple on tap.Overall, this is a GREAT addition to the food and drink options in Hoboken, and finally provides a non-Italian upscale dining spot for us.

Wow!  Talk about an incredible addition to the Hoboken restaurant scene!My boyfriend and I came to Grand Vin last night for dinner even though we were hesitant about going so soon after they'd opened.  The restaurant/bar was absolutely hopping with people and is so beautiful on the inside!  We waited about 45 minutes for a table (to be expected - they just opened and were packed and were not accepting reservations).  While we waited, we ordered two glasses of wine and were able to find a spot to hang out against the bar.  The hostess took our coats and checked them into coatcheck free of charge.  The wine was excellent - we had the Riesling and the Carmenere.  Once seated, we were seated at one of the tables by the bar.  Before we ordered, the owner, Dan, came over and introduced himself.  We asked him for wine and food recommendations and we ended up going with three of his recs!  He absolutely exuded excitement and passion for the food, drink, and space and it was so nice to meet him!  We ordered the Truffle Fries and Tuna Tartare for appetizers and two more glasses of wine - the Pinotage and Riesling.  Both appetizers were INCREDIBLE!  My boyfriend said it was the best tartare he's ever had.  The truffle fries were super flavorful and crispy and we loved them!For our entrees, we ordered the Parmesan Gnocchi and Halibut - we were absolutely dying over how delicious each entree was.  We both cleaned our plates (and these were generous portions) and loved every bite!  The Gnocchi were delicious little pillows in the most flavorful three-cheese sauce and I can't wait to order them again!  Dan came over once again after we paid the bill and comped us two shots of Fireball and Jameson!  It was really nice that he followed up his initial introduction to check on how our dinner went and to give us the shots - we really appreciated the touch!  I also have to say that our waitress, Ariane, was exceptional!  She allowed us to taste the wines before ordering and was the consummate professional even though the restaurant was PACKED with people.We are recommending Grand Vin to all of our friends and cannot wait to return to try other dishes on the menu!  My boyfriend and I both agreed that Grand Vin is now among our favorite restaurants in Hoboken (in good company with the Karma Kafe) and a perfect fit for the area.  Can't wait until they start serving brunch and offering their Wine School!

Excellent date spot or night out. Had the veal meatballs as an appetizer. Absolutely amazing. Best meatballs I have ever had. Drank the dogfish brine all night. Good drink selection. Wait for a table was about an house because it was busy and went out without any prior notifications. Both owners and manager were attentive to our needs and feelings along with Roberta our server who might I add was amazing. I had the steak which was cooked exactly to how I asked and delicious cooked over onions red and green peppers. My girlfriend had the Hoboken shrimp wrapped in prosciutto. Portions were larger than expected and absolutely delicious and filling. Spacing between openers and entrees was perfect. Enough time to remain hungry and have proper conversation. Dessert we had the dulce de leche cake. Small but phenomenal.

I've been to GV on several locations and have tried the majority of the menu. I can honestly say there is nothing I wouldn't order again. Some of the standouts are the gnocchi, strip steak and lobster ravioli, all absolutely to die for! The wait staff is super friendly and very attentive and the bartenders are also first class. Everybody I've asked is pretty knowledgable on wine pairing but is not afraid to ask the owner of they're not sure what goes with your meal. Speaking of owners, Dan and Jeff do an amazing job of hosting their diners and making sure they leave pleased with the experience. It's always refreshing to have the owner come out to introduce themselves and see if everything is to your liking. Atmosphere is great, decor is beautiful and they have live music on weekends. I will continue to visit regularly and recommend you give it a try!

Went last night with fiance and another couple. Got off to a promising start, they were able to sit us early. Unfortunately went pretty much downhill from there. It took 30 minutes for us to even get to order drinks, another 15 for them to actually show up. This was after we flagged down the guitarist so that he could could a waitress or anyone's atrwntion. Had to wait yet another 30 minutes to get bread, literally just one slice per person. It was warm in the outside but cold on the inside.Finally got our appetizers, which were actually delicious. Tuna tartar, baked clams and artichoke. All of our entrees were also pretty good, but the portions were a bit small (shrimp and the special pork shank.) Overall. Just a disappointing experience. Maybe it was a "off" night, I may give it another shot sometime but I'm in no rush to do so. It was also pretty pricey for the portion sizes and even higher since all we could do was order drinks during the time we spent waiting.

My husband and I have dined here a few times since it changed over from Three As.  Each dining experience has been fantastic.  First, the ambiance when you walk in is comfortable and welcoming.  You certainly don't feel like you are in Hoboken; it is more of a vineyard/wine country experience.  Amazing job of renovating and redecorating from the Three As scene.  Kudos to the developers who thought this up.  On several occasions, there was live music as well (acoustic guitar), which was a perfect complement to the atmosphere.  The musician was really talented, and played a mix of country and classic rock.Second, the food was delicious.  We've had the fish (salmon, halibut, branzino, shrimp), pork chops, short ribs, and various appetizers.  Some of these reviews seem to complain about the price.  Quality food is not cheap, however.  The quality here is top notch.  If you are looking for more "bar food" prices, then there are plenty of more generic, cheaper spots in Hoboken.  If you are willing to pay for a nice meal, then you won't be disappointed at Grand Vin.Third, the wine list is varied, but not overwhelming.  The servers are more than happy to provide tastings for any wine if you are not sure about your selection.  We've not sampled the cocktails yet, but they look interesting.  Most of them are made with wine, which is definitely unique.  Looking forward to sampling these once the outdoor seating becomes available in a couple weeks.Finally, the service was great.  This definitely adds to the ambiance.  You feel like you are at a small, boutique dining experience...not a cookie cutter "in and out" meal. Definitely looking forward to visiting Grand Vin again.
Waking into restaurant the decor was wonderful, drink were on point, and the food was amazing. The restaurant added a nice touch with live music. Everyone super friendly and cater to your needs.

Was in last night for an early dinner. Split a half portion capellini for a starter and I had the pork chop while my girlfriend had the healthy salad with shrimp. Everything was delicious! The pork chop with peppers was perfectly cooked and a good value compared to other local spots. A half portion of the pasta was probably enough for a full individual meal. The mango salad dressing was legit too.

Okay so went here on a Thursday night and our experience was horrible. The hosts kept chatting amongst themselves and didn't attend us. We called for a rigatoni pasta and we were offered something else which was nothing similar to the description. Later when we complained about it..we were given a replacement which was not good at all. We were really disappointed with this place. Only the ambience is amazing but the service and food are not good.

Met a friend here on Monday night. Good ambiance and wine selection. Had the veal meatballs which were delicious. The truffle fries left a bit to be desired. Presentation was lacking (could've used fresh parsley, shaved parmesan, etc) and they looked like frozen fries. I'd skip that on the menu.

I went on Friday night with a girlfriend for dinner. The restaurant has a great atmosphere. It reminded me of California wine country. The cocktail list was interesting. They had lots of different kinds of drinks. I'll have to try the brine next time (beer and wine mixed). We shared two appetizers, a pasta dish and an entree and were stuffed. Favorites were the veal meatballs, chicken francaise and the gnocchi. The menu is varied so there is something for everyone.The staff was attentive and special shout out to the owner Dan for checking up on us to ensure everything was great.Can't wait to come back and try some other entrees and as well as the brunch, which the menu said was coming soon!

Went here tonight with w friend. Seated at a high table at 7pm on Saturday with no wait which was great. Server was attentive and gave us suggestions on wine.  We ordered a salad to start which was yummy. There's free bread for table which was great but we had to ask for. We both ordered the stuffed chicken which was good. Neither one of us thought it was amazing though.  Ended with a shared caramel lava cake which was tasty. They have affordable and delicious wine options.   Only watch out is they charged us 49 dollars for a bottle in the menu that was supposed to be 42.  They adjusted the bill bit just watch the bill.  Will try again as the location works for me and the decor is nice.

I was very excited to try Grand Vin as there looked to finally be a great local food/drink spot to replace 3As. The interior is nice, good decor and vibe. However, the menu is fairly limited and overpriced. They do a good job on some dishes and others leave you quite underwhelmed. In general, the pastas are a safe choice (although $20 for rigatoni in a watery cream sauce is pricey). Steer clear of the Branzino with grilled vegetables. The dish comes with two thin filets (albeit nicely seasoned) and FIVE thin overcooked zucchini rounds. I had to ration each round into small bites to try and make it last through the meal -- no luck. There were no other sides on the plate, just the empty space staring back. The meal was $26. Same story with the Spiedino appetizer. GV's take on fried mozzarella. Be prepared to receive nothing more than a small grilled cheese sandwich battered and fried, served with a side of salty anchovy sauce. This dish was $12 for two pieces of white bread with melted cheese. I'll go back for the location, good service and ambiance for a glass of wine or two at the bar -- but won't be dropping another $100 on a meal that leaves you walking out the door hungry.

This was an amazing restaurant! I spent my 1 year anniversary with my boyfriend here and everything from the greeting at the front door to our server to the food was amazing! The decor was beautiful and the food was delish  our waiter was super friendly. I felt really comfortable and totally recommend this restaurant for anyone.

After staring at the tiny print and extremely long wine list of many varieties I've never heard of we decided on the house chardonnay which was really good. It would be helpful to have descriptions of the lesser known wine and offer a flight to try a few or at least a sommelier to explain. The food was excellent they served bread with olive oil that was infused with fresh basil which was delicious. We tried 3 varieties of cheese a goat/truffle, gouda and sharp variety, and the veal meatballs which were in a fantastic tomato sauce (tasted very fresh and not sweet). After that we were pretty full but decided to try the snapper special which was awesome it was covered in a creamy sauce and served with mashed potatoes. Definitely not the healthiest meal, but it was all delicious. I'm not a fan of most Hoboken restaurants, its great to find a place in town I can look forward to coming back to.

I feel like Hoboken has tried to mimic a restaurant like this for quite some time but always falls short. This place has a great atmosphere and all the food was delicious. Definitely have to make a reservation for the time being since it seems like the hot new place in town but it's definitely worth it, try the capellini if you're a pasta person!
Love this place, awesome food, great decor, excellent service. Can't go wrong with any part of the menu!
This place wasn't out of this world or seem like a real winery type place, but it'll do for the location. Food was ok. I wouldn't come back but it's worth trying once.
Went here for brunch. Food was delicious and service was great! Will definitely be coming back when I'm in the area.

My boyfriend and I have made nearly weekly appearances at this restaurant since it opened, and it never disappoints. The atmosphere is wonderful, the wine and cocktails are excellent, and the food (omg the ravioli) is amazing. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking to escape the Hoboken sports bars for a higher class, great wine bar!

A little disappointed. We had a 8:30 reservation. Sat down immediately and ordered drinks. Drinks came around 9:15. A little long to wait for a drink. The service was incredibly slow and the portion sizes very small for $25-35 per plate. They said portions were big enough to share and I didn't think so at all. Also not a true Italian meal. A lot better options around town. I was upset because the decor was so cute  and welcoming. Also no AC. Realllllly hot inside.
Only giving 4 stars because the service still needs improvement. It definitely takes some time to get your food, but nonetheless it comes out hot and delicious. Love this place !

I came here over a month ago and thought it was great. I came back tonight and was beyond disappointed and frustrated in every aspect of my experience. There are way too many issues to even list but the main one I need to say is that this place needs to figure out its identity. Is it a dive bar or it is a classy restaurant? The menu claims 'you don't have to go to Manhattan to get the Manhattan experience' but what I experienced was an utter disaster. We paid for appetizers at the bar that never came, even after waiting an hour and a half. We tried really hard to give this place the benefit of the doubt because of our first experience but this time we couldn't wait to leave. Long story short: you may pay Manhattan prices but don't expect Manhattan experience.

Well wasnt sure what o expect , went for a friends birthday . There was about 10 of us. Draft beers were not available due to it being broke. But it was a nice place, all people very friendly, waiter was quick an seemed to appreciate our party. Beer menu was great.  We had some apps that were good. Kept alll the glasses filled , which i guess was a good thing, but not sure if they were just trying to increase the bill. We ordered Jack Daniels shots which seemed a little watered down, but gave us a whole round on the house. My girl got a jack an ginger and seemed the same way so id stick with beer an or wine. Over all if i lived closer id go back , food that other people ordered looked great an there was no short of people coming in an out and they had some live music as well. Again i know i seemed a little critical but id go back or recommend it
Obsessed with this place. Hoboken needed a new date night spot and this is it. The vibe is rustic and chic, wine and food on point. Heard that they are starting wine tasting happy hours- can't wait!
Made a reservation and stood in line for 5 minutes to check in for it...host then tells us we're late and gave our table away to others...AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!!!
